p: As shown in literature, pentacyclic triterpenes (ursolic and oleanolic acid, lupeol, amirin and their acetate derivatives) are present in the green parts and flower heads of C. acaulis [ 11]. Since these compounds are non-polar, they should also be present in the oil fraction [ 31]. Although they were found in seeds of many plants species [ 31, 32, 33], the chromatographic analysis revealed the absence of these triterpenes in the oil from C. acaulis cypselae.
